remarks: The partially evaluated curry functor at a morphism.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Jan-2017.)
statement:
curfval.g $e |- G = ( <. C , D >. curryF F ) $.
curfval.a $e |- A = ( Base ` C ) $.
curfval.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. Cat ) $.
curfval.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. Cat ) $.
curfval.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( ( C Xc. D ) Func E ) ) $.
curfval.b $e |- B = ( Base ` D ) $.
curf1.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. A ) $.
curf1.k $e |- K = ( ( 1st ` G ) ` X ) $.
curf11.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. B ) $.
curf12.j $e |- J = ( Hom ` D ) $.

curf12.y $e |- ( ph -> Z e. B ) $.
curf12.g $e |- ( ph -> H e. ( Y J Z ) ) $.
curf12 $p |- ( ph -> ( ( Y ( 2nd ` K ) Z ) ` H ) = ( ( .1. ` X ) ( <. X , Y >. ( 2nd ` F ) <. X , Z >. ) H ) ) $.
